did.abstract: Gordon Charles wrote syndicated columns on travel and outdoor activities for local Michigan newspapers. His collection contains his journals, copies and clippings of his articles, his books, subject files, slides, photographs, and correspondence.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: This collection was donated by Gordon Charles (donor no. 9801) on October 31, 2006 and from his estate on May 31, 2007

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are not expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Gordon Charles papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Gordon Charles, born on August 23, 1920 in Salisbury, NC, wrote many articles on travel and outdoor activities. These syndicated columns were published in local Michigan newspapers such as the Traverse City Record-Eagle and The Flint Journal.

After Charles was born, the family moved from North Carolina to Cincinnati and then to Columbus, OH. The family finally settled in Traverse City, MI, where Charles attended and graduated high school. It was during this time that Charles started writing in journals detailing his day-to-day life. After high school he attended the Chapin School of Business. He then entered the Army where he worked in radio intelligence for 2 1/2 years. He then completed correspondence classes in journalism.

In 1945, Charles worked as a radio announcer, newscaster and commentator for WTCM in Traverse City, MI. He left WTCM for the Traverse City Record-Eagle in 1953 where he worked as a reporter and columnist. He began his weekly column "Outdoors with Gordie" at this time. In 1956, he became the outdoor editor for the paper.

In 1961, Charles moved to South Dakota to work as a Communications Specialist with the South Dakota Department of Game, Fish and Parks-Information and Education Series. He wrote news stories, magazine articles, and produced the weekly radio show "South Dakota Outdoors." In 1962, Charles was promoted to Chief of Information and Education for the Department.

Unable to pursue his own writing, he left South Dakota in 1965 and moved back to Michigan and became the editor for the Michigan Out-of-Doors. He continued to write articles for the Traverse City Record-Eagle until he retired in the mid-1990s. Charles died May 2, 2007.

scopecontent.p: The Gordon Charles papers contain his journals, copies and clippings of his articles, his books, subject files, slides, photographs, and correspondence related to his work as travel and outdoor activities writer for local Michigan newspapers. The papers are divided up into three series: Personal, Articles, and Subject Files.

The Personal series includes journals, books, and various articles written about Charles. The series also contains his work and activities with the South Dakota Department of Game, Fish, and Parks and Family Information, including photographs and genealogical information.

did.unittitle: Rita Moretti Show and Eye on Michigan (interview about Egypt)
E.F. Charles' (father) World War II Records and Civil Defense Pamphlets
A Boy, A Bike and Buster material and press clippings
A Guided to Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore, 1975
Stalking and Capturing the Wild Pun, 2005
South Dakota Department of Game, Fish, and Parks
Traverse City High School Class of 1939

scopecontent.p: The Articles series includes outdoors and travel columns primarily published for the Traverse City Record-Eagle and for various Michigan local papers. The articles are divided up by year, by month, and by region based on Charles' original organizational scheme for these materials

did.unittitle: Traverse City Record-Eagle: Travel News by Region
Traverse City Record-Eagle: Travel News by Month, 1994-1998
Traverse City Record-Eagle: Articles, book binding copy, 1983-1991

scopecontent.p: The Subject Files series is further divided by Subject and Location. These include files on a number of subjects related to the outdoors. The Location subseries includes Charles' files on a number of locations, local and international. Many of these files are related to his work as a Travel Writer and include articles and slides related to various locales. There are also a number of Michigan cities, parks, outdoor activities, wildlife, and man-made features such as lighthouses and dams.

did.unittitle: Deer, South Fox Island and North and South Manitou Island
Mackinac Island, Ft. Michilimackinac and Parade
Sleeping Bear Dunes National Park and Leland, MI
